name: Streaming Overload
the-point: Are there too many streaming services now, and should we go back to cable?
context: Discusses consumer fatigue and market fragmentation.

name: Spoiler Etiquette
the-point: How long should you wait after a movie comes out before you can talk about spoilers publicly?
context: Social rules in the digital age.

name: Remake Culture
the-point: Should Hollywood stop making remakes and only focus on original stories?

name: Social Media Fame
the-point: Is being a 'TikToker' or 'Influencer' a real career that will last 20 years?
context: The evolution of the labor market.

name: Binge Watching
the-point: Is it better to drop a whole season at once or release episodes weekly to build hype?

name: Superhero Fatigue
the-point: Have we reached the limit of how many superhero movies the world actually needs?

name: Physical Media
the-point: Is it worth owning DVDs and Vinyls, or is digital ownership 'good enough'?

name: Reality TV
the-point: Is reality TV a 'guilty pleasure' or is it actually damaging to how we view real life?

name: Ad-Free Future
the-point: Would you rather pay $50 a month for zero ads anywhere, or have everything free with constant ads?

name: Video Game Art
the-point: Can a video game be considered a higher form of art than a traditional novel?

name: Concert Cellphones
the-point: Should artists ban cellphones at concerts to force people to be 'in the moment'?

name: Method Acting
the-point: Is method acting impressive, or is it just an excuse for actors to be difficult on set?

name: AI Music
the-point: If an AI writes a song that makes you cry, does the lack of human 'soul' make the emotion fake?

name: Movie Theaters
the-point: Will movie theaters exist in 50 years, or will everything be home-VR?

name: Celebrity Privacy
the-point: Do celebrities 'sign away' their right to privacy the moment they become famous?

name: The Golden Age
the-point: What was the best decade for music, and why will it never be topped?

name: Fan Theories
the-point: Do fan theories sometimes make a story better than the actual ending the writers wrote?

name: Award Shows
the-point: Are the Oscars and Grammys still relevant, or are they just industry self-congratulation?

name: Child Stars
the-point: Should children be allowed to be professional actors/influencers before they are 18?

name: Book Snobbery
the-point: Does listening to an audiobook 'count' as having read the book?

name: CGI vs Practical
the-point: Is 1990s CGI sometimes better than modern CGI because they had to try harder?

name: Niche vs Mainstream
the-point: Does 'selling out' actually exist anymore, or should artists just get their money?

name: Ending Spoilers
the-point: Is a story worth watching if you already know how it ends?

name: Fashion Cycles
the-point: Is there any truly 'new' fashion, or are we just repeating the 70s, 80s, and 90s forever?

name: Global Media
the-point: Will English remain the dominant language of global entertainment, or is the future non-English?
